title: Sports Illustrated Prospered When It Was Mostly Sports
text: Regarding Bob Greene’s “When Sports Illustrated Was Great” (op-ed, Oct. 9) lamenting the demise of Sports Illustrated, I suggest he should look further back than the corporate takeovers, restructuring and deaths of prominent SI individuals. I also revered Sports Illustrated as a young boy, teenager and adult. I wasn’t a hoarder but I read each issue cover to cover and eventually came to the realization that SI lost its way. Editors decided to drift away from reporting strictly on the sports world and began publishing pieces on social activism, politics and opinion. Sports Illustrated’s original mission became an afterthought...
description: Editors decided to drift away from reporting strictly on the sports world and became an active participant in social activism.
